thread.title: Trump Calls For Supplies To Keep Executive Orders Flowing
thread.title_full: Trump Calls For Supplies To Keep Executive Orders Flowing

author: Jack Davis
title: Trump Calls For Supplies To Keep Executive Orders Flowing
text:
Trump Calls For Supplies To Keep Executive Orders Flowing "I think we're going to need more ..." by Jack Davis February 17, 2017 at 1:44pm Share on Facebook Share Tweet Email Email Print Advertisement - story continues below 
President Donald Trump made it clear with his take-charge press conference Thursday that his effort to reshape government has not gone off the rails. 
But it has developed a shortage of something vital to implement the executive orders Trump is using to dismantle regulations and jump-start new policy: pens . 
Ever since Trump took office on Jan. 20, he has been signing executive orders and legislation and giving away the pens as souvenirs to various legislators or staff members. Advertisement - story continues below 
— Mark Knoller (@markknoller) February 16, 2017 
“I think we’re going to need some more pens, by the way,” Trump said on Inauguration Day as he signed nominations and executive orders. 
The Rhode Island-based A.T. Cross Co. has supplied ceremonial pens for several presidents, beginning with the Ford administration, including former President Barack Obama. Trump’s are different in that he prefers gold-plated pens over the chrome-plated ones Obama used. Advertisement - story continues below 
Cross recently shipped out 350 pens for Trump’s use, said company spokesman Andy Boss. 
“He absolutely, positively, had to have them by Friday,” said Boss. “My guess is he’s running low.” 
Although Trump makes waves with the orders he signs, Boss is more focused on what Trump uses to write his name. 
“To me it doesn’t matter whether the president is a Republican or a Democrat. Just having a president using our pens is pretty cool,” Boss said. “I’d much rather him using our pens than somebody else’s.” Advertisement - story continues below
